level.text: There shall be one (1) timekeeper-tender for each surface-tender (hard-hat) diver and one (1) timekeeper-tender for each scuba diving buddy pair.
In addition to tending the diver(s), the timekeeper-tender shall keep accurate and legible records of the following:
The duration of the dive; and
The timekeeper-tender also shall do the following:
Know the probable duration of the apparatus in the case of scuba dives;
Notify the diving master when the diver’s time is up;
Foresee decompression if necessary and warn the diving master soon enough to make adequate arrangements; and
Give the diving master the proper decompression schedule.
The records of the timekeeper-tender shall be kept on file for at least twenty-four (24) months.
